title: Which champ fits my playstyle?
body:
I really want a new champ, but none seem to fit my playstyle.

So basically, which champion is my most fitting?

I want one that is somewhat simple to play. It can be a bit average difficulty though.

I want to do a little bit of damage, while being a tank.

I hate csing, its too hard for me despite being really advantageous later in the game.

I hate going on mana issues, although I try to do my best not to burn it out.

And yeah, I am sure thats it..

So can someone tell me which champion fits my playstyle so I can try out?

replies.body:
Vlad. 

Easy to play, easy to farm, gets tanky with 6 items. no mana issues.

Completely agree, after reading OP's description, I instantly thought of Vlad.
As a Vlad mainer, He is everything that fits your description.

I literally logged in to say Vlad, but CSM beat me to it.
So i'll just upvote this comment, and add: He has many routes of build to take.
But the best thing about Vlad is, you can counter build and still win trades.

oh... and please don't pool minions.
and early game dont Q minions... maybe the Siege minion...

early game, vlad has pretty high cooldown. Q the enemy laner, rather than a minion. once you've got it down on cool down, feel free to q all the minions, but i find e and auto attack early game works well.

Malphite.
Go for tanky build.
In team fight, press R
GG
If you hate csing and want to be tanky while dealing some damage, naut support or gragas jungle work

Vladimir is good top, very tanky with significant damage, and now that WotA and hextech stack, he can recover more health than the enemy can take away sometimes, for CS just spam E (hits every unit within range) 

Garen is about as simple as it gets, use his spin for CS, he has no mana, he deals 1/3 of your health with his ult and all the rest of it with his E while they're silenced the whole time with Q he's tanky as fuck while still having lots of AD but actually does magic damage which makes him very hard to build against and regenerates like 100+ hp a second with his passive (but dont play garen, i wont be pleased knowing that theres another one out there) 

Taric is my favourite tanky support, he is about as survivable as it gets with an armour buff a heal and a stun, you're a support so theres no need to cs and while he doesn't do mega damage, once you have a few items you can 1v1 any adc in the game and win (Vayne is an exception) 

Skarner is a jungler but you can play him top if you don't like ganking, he has no dashes or invisibles or anything hard that requires positioning, just run in spamming Q, grab them with R, run out spamming Q, by the time R ends you'll have enough stacks to stun them, he does Aoe damage and Q is spam able so CSing isn't a problem, and he does a lot of mixed damage while being a tank, but he is a little hungry on the mana early, so a iceborn or something might be required.
Shen top maybe. Uses energy so no mana issues. Easy to cs with. Build mostly tank items. Build a trinity at some point and you'll be dealing some nice damage with that tank
you want a tanky damage dealing champ and you hate farming and mana? REALLY? HAVENT HEARD THAT ONE BEFORE

If you can't CS (and don't want to practice it), play Jungle or Support.

JUNGLE
Shyvanna: (Devourer + Bork is the only damage items she needs)
Garen: (4 tank items + Black Cleaver + boots)
Zac:  (builds tanky, can build 1 or 2 AP items if you are ahead for extra damage like Rylais, Liandries or Abysal)
Volibear: (builds Health and does extra damage)
Xin Zhao:  (Same as shyvanna. Devourer + Bork + 3 tank items + boots)
Gragas:  (build tanky not AP, still does plenty of damage)

SUPPORT
Leona - Tanky, does suprising amount of damage.
Volibear - not a traditional support. Requires a lot of practice but can do plenty of damage.
Taric - His Ult is bullsht strong. He is tanky as f too
Nautilus - surprising amount of damage and tanky

Other tanky supports: Shen/Gragas/Alistar/Braum/Tahm Kench. These guys are more tanky and CC than damage providers

>I hate csing, its too hard for me despite being really advantageous later in the game.

Jungle/support are probably best then, theres no real way around farming in the other roles.

For jungle you could try stuff like Shyvana, Udyr, Warwick, Volibear

For support Leona, Nautilus, Taric
